eg.ui.tabpane

Class ExtTabbedPane

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JTabbedPane
            • eg.ui.tabpane.ExtTabbedPane
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants

    public class ExtTabbedPane
extends javax.swing.JTabbedPane
    A JTabbedPane with a close button in the tabs, the possibility to show and hide the tab bar and a somewhat changed tab appearance. The tab placement is restricted to be at the top.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • showTabbar

        public void showTabbar(boolean b)
        Sets the specified boolean that indicates if the tabbar is shown or hidden
        Parameters:
        b - the boolean
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if b is false and more than one tab is open

      • addTab

        public void addTab(java.lang.String title,
                   java.awt.Component c,
                   javax.swing.JButton closeBt)
        Adds a new tab.

        It is required that the specified closeBt has got an ActionListener added. This listener must first call this method iTabMouseOver().

        Parameters:
        title - the title for the tab
        c - the component to be displayed when the tab is selected
        closeBt - the button displayed in the tab
